name: Your Quest
description: Your Quest is a casual 2D Strategy/RPG with progressive gameplay where you gather resources to construct a village, craft new weapons and armor, and try to survive the depths of a procedurally generated dungeon under the surface.
minimum_requirements: OS: Any version of Windows that supports 32-bit applications. Graphics: Any graphics card that supports Shader Model 1.1 or better. DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 201 MB available space

reviews.review_text: So many world corruptions that make this game unplayable. Every hour i get a corrupted world and loose all my progress. If this is fixed i will update this review.  Edit: They fixed the problem and seem to take what is said and change things fast we will see how it goes.  Edit 2: The dev is working to make the game better and more customizable, thought this game already is very customizable. Make the world yours

nice little game, need to play it more, but i love it for what it is. needs improvements like making swords costs a lot less ressources to craft i think its a bit exagerated that you need 100 wood and 50 stone for a sword, you guys should make it the same as a pickaxe or axe. but its a fine game and good idea :)

When I first got this game it was frustrating to get used to the controls. But after an hour of playing I realized that the problem wasn't the controls, it was the pace of the game. Since the whole point of the game is to build a village untill your ready to conquer a dungeon, you spend most your time building and gathering resources. But it takes forever to do that, and it shouldn't. I thought after I got workers to collect wood and stone for me, it would be less time consuming to collect enough resources needed to build houses for my village. Wich is true, but it still takes about a minute to put down a damn fence or remove a field, Wich is a problem because when your building or removing something, you can't move. Basically what I'm saying is most the time your staring at your screen as your removing something or building something, and being someone who is used to fast paced gameplay, I find this extremely boring. If your patient and keep an open mind then maybe you will have fun, but I'm done with this game.
